thread.title: Globetrotters announce former Duncanville standout has made team
thread.title_full: Globetrotters announce former Duncanville standout has made team | Dallas Morning News

author: Tommy Cummings
title: Globetrotters announce former Duncanville standout has made team
text:
Davene "Viper" Carter has parlayed his ability to jump high into an entertainment career. The Harlem Globetrotters on Thursday announced their rookie class of 2016 and it included Carter.
Carter, who played his high school basketball at Duncanville, finished third in the 2015 NCAA Division II dunk competition while competing for Tarleton State in Stephenville. He led the team in rebounding his final two seasons. As a 6-6 senior, he blocked 40 shots. Carter shot 66 percent from the floor during his career with the Texans.
Carter was a starter on the 2014-15 squad that set a school record with 31 victories and reached the NCAA Division II Final Four for only the second time in program history.
He was a standout high jumper at Duncanville and competed three years on the Tartleton track and field team where he twice qualified for the NCAA Division II track and field championships in the high jump. His career-best jump was more than seven feet.
The Phoenix-based Globetrotters also announced three more players in advance of their 2016 world tour. Larriques "Beast" Cunningham of Lee University in Tennessee, Crissa "Ace" Jackson of Savannah (Ga.) State and Carde "Rocket" Pennington of Dakota Wesleyan University.
The world tour starts Dec. 26 and continues through April 2016. The Globetrotters will play 330 games in more than 260 cities in 48 states, eight Canadian provinces and Puerto Rico. They'll make a stop at the American Airlines Center in Dallas on Jan. 30-31.
"We can't wait to hit the floor and celebrate our 90th year with families around the world," Globetrotters Legend Sweet Lou Dunbar, the team's director of player personnel, said in a release.
